meanings.def: a situation in which a group of people behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest
examples: One prison guard was killed when a riot broke out in the jail.
He was killed in the riots.
Shortages eventually led to food riots.
Prison riots broke out over worsening conditions.
The city's housing and unemployment problems provoked serious riots.
a riot against bread prices
the violent draft riots during the Civil War
Food riots resulted in two deaths and looting throughout the city.
His arrest caused widespread riots that the government suppressed with brutality.

meanings.def: a collection of a lot of different types of the same thing
examples: The garden was a riot of colour.
The market was a riot of unfamiliar sounds and smells.
A riot of emotions raged through her.

meanings.def: a person or an event that is very funny
examples: The movie is a laugh riot.

meanings.def: to tell somebody with force that they must not do something
to behave in a way that is violent and/or not under control
examples: They let their kids run riot.
Local youths ran riot after the attack.

meanings.def: if your imagination, a feeling, etc. runs riot, you allow it to develop and continue without trying to control it
examples: An artist must learn to let his imagination run riot.
These prejudices have been allowed to run riot for too long.

meanings.def: to behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest
examples: Students all over the country rioted against the government.
The fans rioted after their team lost.
